required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase II, Trial of Ixabepilone Plus Cetuximab as First Line Therapy for Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Open Label Trial of Ixabepilone Plus Cetuximab as First Line Therapy for Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn if ixabepilone plus cetuximab improves survival when given as 1st line chemotherapy in subjects with metastatic pancreatic cancer compared to historical data. The safety of this combination treatment will also be studied.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Surviving at 6 Months
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose of study drug through 6 months
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants surviving at 6 months was defined as the number of treated participants who had not died prior to 6 months from the date of their first dose divided by the total number of treated participants.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose of study until 16.49 months (longest period for participant between first dose and documented disease progression)
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor response was assessed according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)= disappearance of all non-target lesions, Partial Response (PR)= at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD; Stable Disease (SD)= neither PR nor progressive disease (PD) criteria were met; PD = at least 20% increase in the sum of the LD of all target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded at or following baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Tumor Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose of study until 16.49 months (longest period for participant between first dose and documented disease progression
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with objective tumor response was determined by the number of participants with PR or CR divided by the total number of response-evaluable participants. Tumor response was assessed according RECIST criteria: PR=at least 30% reduction in the sum of the LD of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD, CR=Disappearance of all non-target lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose of study until 16.49 months (longest period for participant between first dose and documented disease progression
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) time was defined as the time, in months, from the first dosing date until the date of disease progression or death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dosing date until death (last reported death was 21 months after first dose).
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival time was defined as the time in months from the first dosing date to the date of death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first date recorded for CR or PR until the first date of disease progression or death (last participant with tumor response progressed 6.5 months after documented response).
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response was defined as the number of months from when measurement criteria were first met for CR or PR (whichever was recorded first) until the first date of disease progression or death. Complete Response (CR)= disappearance of all non-target lesions, Partial Response (PR)= at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from first dose of study therapy until first date of PR or CR. Maximum time to response was 19 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Time to response was defined as the number of weeks from first dose of study therapy (ixabepilone or cetuximab) until measurement criteria were first met for PR or CR, whichever status was recorded first. Complete Response (CR)= disappearance of all non-target lesions, Partial Response (PR)= at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Death Within 30 Days of Last Dose, Any Serious Adverse Event (SAE), Any Adverse Event (AE) Leading to Discontinuation (DC), or Any Treatment-related AEs By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of first dose of study drug to ≤30 days after the end of the last dose of study drug or until resolution of study drug-related toxicity.
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition not necessarily having a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization/causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, or is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Most Common Treatment-related Nonhematologic AE (>25%) By CTC v3 Grade (Gr)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of first dose of study drug to ≤30 days after the end of the last dose of study drug or until resolution of study drug-related toxicity.
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition not necessarily having a causal relationship with this treatment. Acneform rash and peripheral neuropathy were captured by multiple MedDRA preferred terms. Acneform rash included rash, rash pustular, and rash pruritic preferred terms. Peripheral neuropathy included neuromuscular toxicity, peripheral motor neuropathy, and peripheral sensorimotor neuropathy preferred terms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hematology, Liver Function, and Renal Laboratory Abnormalities By CTC v3 Grade (Gr)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of first dose of study drug to ≤30 days after the end of the last dose of study drug or until resolution of study drug-related toxicity.
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory results were graded according to CTC v 3.0. Hematology laboratory evaluations included absolute neutrophil count (ANC), white blood cell count (WBC), platelets (PLT), and hemoglobin (HGB). Liver function laboratory evaluations included alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alkaline phosphatase, and total bilirubin. Renal function laboratory evaluation included creatinine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose Reduction, Dose Delay, or Dose Interruption
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dosing date of Cycle 1 until the last dosing date of the last cycle. Last dosing cycle for a participant was Cycle 21.
secondary_outcome.description: Dose reduction of ixabepilone and/or cetuximab due to toxicity was permitted for participants deriving benefit from therapy. Each drug could be dose modified independently of the others. Participants unable to start a cycle due to unacceptable toxicity related to ixabepilone or cetuximab could have therapy delayed for up to 4 weeks. If toxicities prevented the administration of ixabepilone or cetuximab therapy, participants continued receiving the other therapy as scheduled. A dose interruption for ixabepilone or cetuximab was defined as any interruption during the infusion period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Baseline Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Tumor Expression
secondary_outcome.description: EGFR expression was evaluated by means of an immunohistochemical assay using tumor tissue collected prior to receiving first dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FHSI-8 Total Score by Time-point
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 3, Week 6, Week 9, Week 12, Week 12, Week 18, Week 24 and every 3 weeks through end of study (participant death/withdrawal from study)
secondary_outcome.description: The FHSI-8 includes eight items representing pancreatic-related symptoms; each symptom is rated by participants on a scale of from 0 to 4. The FHSI-8 total score ranges in value from 0 to 32, with higher scores representing fewer symptoms and lower scores representing more symptoms. Scoring of the FHSI-8 was to be conducted according to the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) manual. The symptom assessment was to include treated participants who had baseline measurement and at least one on-study measurement of FHSI-8 questionnaire.

arm_group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks. In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

intervention.description: Initial dose of 400 mg/m^2 intravenous (IV) over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose of 250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologic or cytologic diagnosis of pancreatic adenocarcinoma (locally advanced disease that is not surgically resectable, or distant metastatic disease)
- Participants must have measurable disease as per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines
- Participants must not have received prior chemotherapy, immunotherapy or chemoradiotherapy for advanced pancreas cancer
- Karnofsky performance status (KPS) of 70-100
- Adequate hematologic, hepatic and renal function

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 58 participants enrolled, 4 were never treated.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Cetuximab
group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks. In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

class.title: Age Greater than, equal to 65 years

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Surviving at 6 Months
outcome.description: The percentage of participants surviving at 6 months was defined as the number of treated participants who had not died prior to 6 months from the date of their first dose divided by the total number of treated participants.
outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose of study drug through 6 months
outcome.population: Treated participants; all participants who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab. Participants who did not die prior to 6 months but dropped out of the study were not included in the numerator.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Cetuximab
group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks. In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Surviving at 6 Months
measure.description: The percentage of participants surviving at 6 months was defined as the number of treated participants who had not died prior to 6 months from the date of their first dose divided by the total number of treated participants.
measure.population: Treated participants; all participants who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab. Participants who did not die prior to 6 months but dropped out of the study were not included in the numerator.

outcome.title: Best Overall Tumor Response
outcome.description: Tumor response was assessed according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria: Complete Response (CR)= disappearance of all non-target lesions, Partial Response (PR)= at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD; Stable Disease (SD)= neither PR nor progressive disease (PD) criteria were met; PD = at least 20% increase in the sum of the LD of all target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum LD recorded at or following baseline.
outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose of study until 16.49 months (longest period for participant between first dose and documented disease progression)
outcome.population: Response-evaluable participants; all participants with measurable disease who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab and who had at least one on-treatment tumor assessment.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Cetuximab
group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks. In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

outcome.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) time was defined as the time, in months, from the first dosing date until the date of disease progression or death from any cause.
outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose of study until 16.49 months (longest period for participant between first dose and documented disease progression
outcome.population: Treated participants; all participants who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab. Participants without disease progression or death were censored at the last tumor assessment.

outcome.time_frame: From the first dosing date until death (last reported death was 21 months after first dose).
outcome.population: Treated participants; all participants who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab. Participants without a reported date of death were censored at the last known alive date.

In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

outcome.title: Median Duration of Response
outcome.description: Duration of response was defined as the number of months from when measurement criteria were first met for CR or PR (whichever was recorded first) until the first date of disease progression or death. Complete Response (CR)= disappearance of all non-target lesions, Partial Response (PR)= at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD.
outcome.time_frame: From first date recorded for CR or PR until the first date of disease progression or death (last participant with tumor response progressed 6.5 months after documented response).
outcome.population: Response-evaluable participants whose best response was PR or CR. Participants without disease progression or death were censored at the last tumor assessment date.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Cetuximab
group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks. Complete Response (CR)= disappearance of all non-target lesions, Partial Response (PR)= at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD.
measure.population: Response-evaluable participants whose best response was PR or CR. Participants without disease progression or death were censored at the last tumor assessment date.

Complete Response (CR)= disappearance of all non-target lesions, Partial Response (PR)= at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD.
outcome.time_frame: Time from first dose of study therapy until first date of PR or CR. Maximum time to response was 19 months.
outcome.population: Response-evaluable participants whose best response was PR or CR.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Cetuximab

In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

measure.description: Time to response was defined as the number of weeks from first dose of study therapy (ixabepilone or cetuximab) until measurement criteria were first met for PR or CR, whichever status was recorded first. Complete Response (CR)= disappearance of all non-target lesions, Partial Response (PR)= at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter (LD) of all target lesions in reference to the baseline sum LD.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Death Within 30 Days of Last Dose, Any Serious Adverse Event (SAE), Any Adverse Event (AE) Leading to Discontinuation (DC), or Any Treatment-related AEs By Common Terminology Criteria Version 3.0 (CTC v3) Grade (Gr)
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition not necessarily having a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization/causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, or is an important medical event.
outcome.time_frame: From the time of first dose of study drug to ≤30 days after the end of the last dose of study drug or until resolution of study drug-related toxicity.
outcome.population: Treated participants; all participants who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab. The 53 participants reporting treatment-related AEs included 1 additional participant who also developed Grade 5 viscous intestinal perforation, which was also captured under death within 30 days of last dose category.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Cetuximab
group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks. In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition not necessarily having a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization/causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, or is an important medical event.
measure.population: Treated participants; all participants who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab. The 53 participants reporting treatment-related AEs included 1 additional participant who also developed Grade 5 viscous intestinal perforation, which was also captured under death within 30 days of last dose category.

class.title: All deaths within 30 days of last dose

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Most Common Treatment-related Nonhematologic AE (>25%) By CTC v3 Grade (Gr)
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition not necessarily having a causal relationship with this treatment. Acneform rash and peripheral neuropathy were captured by multiple MedDRA preferred terms. Acneform rash included rash, rash pustular, and rash pruritic preferred terms. Peripheral neuropathy included neuromuscular toxicity, peripheral motor neuropathy, and peripheral sensorimotor neuropathy preferred terms.
outcome.time_frame: From the time of first dose of study drug to ≤30 days after the end of the last dose of study drug or until resolution of study drug-related toxicity.
outcome.population: Treated participants; all participants who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab.

In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

Acneform rash and peripheral neuropathy were captured by multiple MedDRA preferred terms. Acneform rash included rash, rash pustular, and rash pruritic preferred terms. outcome.title: Number of Participants With Hematology, Liver Function, and Renal Laboratory Abnormalities By CTC v3 Grade (Gr)
outcome.description: Laboratory results were graded according to CTC v 3.0. Hematology laboratory evaluations included absolute neutrophil count (ANC), white blood cell count (WBC), platelets (PLT), and hemoglobin (HGB). Liver function laboratory evaluations included alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alkaline phosphatase, and total bilirubin. Renal function laboratory evaluation included creatinine.
outcome.time_frame: From the time of first dose of study drug to ≤30 days after the end of the last dose of study drug or until resolution of study drug-related toxicity.
outcome.population: Treated participants; all participants who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab. n= number of participants with laboratory data available

group.title: Ixabepilone + Cetuximab
group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks. In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Hematology, Liver Function, and Renal Laboratory Abnormalities By CTC v3 Grade (Gr)
measure.description: Laboratory results were graded according to CTC v 3.0. Hematology laboratory evaluations included absolute neutrophil count (ANC), white blood cell count (WBC), platelets (PLT), and hemoglobin (HGB). Liver function laboratory evaluations included alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alkaline phosphatase, and total bilirubin. Renal function laboratory evaluation included creatinine.
measure.population: Treated participants; all participants who received at least one dose of ixabepilone or cetuximab. n= number of participants with laboratory data available

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Dose Reduction, Dose Delay, or Dose Interruption
outcome.description: Dose reduction of ixabepilone and/or cetuximab due to toxicity was permitted for participants deriving benefit from therapy. Each drug could be dose modified independently of the others. Participants unable to start a cycle due to unacceptable toxicity related to ixabepilone or cetuximab could have therapy delayed for up to 4 weeks. If toxicities prevented the administration of ixabepilone or cetuximab therapy, participants continued receiving the other therapy as scheduled. A dose interruption for ixabepilone or cetuximab was defined as any interruption during the infusion period.
outcome.time_frame: From the first dosing date of Cycle 1 until the last dosing date of the last cycle. Last dosing cycle for a participant was Cycle 21.
outcome.population: Since the combination of ixabepilone and cetuximab tested in this trial failed to meet the primary objective of sufficiently improving 6-month survival rate relative to historical control in participants with metastatic pancreatic cancer, dose modification data were collected but not summarized.

group.title: Ixabepilone
group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks.

group.title: Cetuximab
group.description: All participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Dose Reduction, Dose Delay, or Dose Interruption
measure.description: Dose reduction of ixabepilone and/or cetuximab due to toxicity was permitted for participants deriving benefit from therapy. Each drug could be dose modified independently of the others. Participants unable to start a cycle due to unacceptable toxicity related to ixabepilone or cetuximab could have therapy delayed for up to 4 weeks. If toxicities prevented the administration of ixabepilone or cetuximab therapy, participants continued receiving the other therapy as scheduled. A dose interruption for ixabepilone or cetuximab was defined as any interruption during the infusion period.
measure.population: Since the combination of ixabepilone and cetuximab tested in this trial failed to meet the primary objective of sufficiently improving 6-month survival rate relative to historical control in participants with metastatic pancreatic cancer, dose modification data were collected but not summarized.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Baseline Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Tumor Expression
outcome.description: EGFR expression was evaluated by means of an immunohistochemical assay using tumor tissue collected prior to receiving first dose.
outcome.population: Tissue was available for a small proportion of patients and only 1 out of 11 was EGFR positive, hence EFGR expression analysis was not performed.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Cetuximab
group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks. In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

measure.population: Tissue was available for a small proportion of patients and only 1 out of 11 was EGFR positive, hence EFGR expression analysis was not performed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in FHSI-8 Total Score by Time-point
outcome.description: The FHSI-8 includes eight items representing pancreatic-related symptoms; each symptom is rated by participants on a scale of from 0 to 4. The FHSI-8 total score ranges in value from 0 to 32, with higher scores representing fewer symptoms and lower scores representing more symptoms. Scoring of the FHSI-8 was to be conducted according to the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) manual. The symptom assessment was to include treated participants who had baseline measurement and at least one on-study measurement of FHSI-8 questionnaire.

outcome.population: Since the combination of ixabepilone and cetuximab tested in this trial failed to meet the primary objective of sufficiently improving 6-month survival rate relative to historical control in participants with metastatic pancreatic cancer, FHSI-8 score data were collected but not summarized.

In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

measure.description: The FHSI-8 includes eight items representing pancreatic-related symptoms; each symptom is rated by participants on a scale of from 0 to 4. The FHSI-8 total score ranges in value from 0 to 32, with higher scores representing fewer symptoms and lower scores representing more symptoms. Scoring of the FHSI-8 was to be conducted according to the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) manual. The symptom assessment was to include treated participants who had baseline measurement and at least one on-study measurement of FHSI-8 questionnaire.
measure.population: Since the combination of ixabepilone and cetuximab tested in this trial failed to meet the primary objective of sufficiently improving 6-month survival rate relative to historical control in participants with metastatic pancreatic cancer, FHSI-8 score data were collected but not summarized.

group.title: Ixabepilone + Cetuximab
group.description: All participants were administered ixabepilone at a starting dose of 32 mg/m^2 as a 3-hour intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks. In addition, all participants were administered an initial dose of cetuximab (400 mg/m^2 IV over 2 hours) followed by a weekly lower dose (250 mg/m^2 IV over 1 hour).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study CA163-116 was completed; however, the combination tested in this trial failed to meet the primary objective to demonstrate a 6-month survival rate greater than 50% in participants with metastatic pancreatic cancer.
